sentences.sContent: Some churches have also begun to allow "intinction" or dipping bread in communion wine rather than sharing the chalice, while others have stopped offering wine altogether, the newspaper said.
sentences.sContent_eng: Some churches have also begun to allow "intinction" or dipping bread in communion wine rather than sharing the chalice, while others have stopped offering wine altogether, the newspaper said.
sentences.sCn: 报纸上说，有的教堂已经开始允许用面包蘸圣餐酒，不再共用圣餐杯，而其他一些教堂则完全停止供应集体圣餐酒了。

remMethod.val: 拉丁语为calix， 英语中也有calix， 和chalice同词根同词义

trans.tranOther: a gold or silver decorated cup used, for example, to hold wine in Christian religious services
